flawed_nl_solution:
If Abel needs to travel 1000 miles going 50 miles per hour, this means it will take him 1000/50=<<1000/50=20.0>>20.0 hours to get there.
If Alice needs to travel 1000 miles going 40 miles per hour, this means it will take her 1000/40=<<1000/40=25.0>>25.0 hours to get there.
Since there are 60 minutes in an hour, this means it will take Abel 20.0*60= <<20.0*60=1200.0>>1200.0 minutes to arrive.
Similarly, this means it will take Alice 25.0*60= <<25.0*60=1500.0>>1500.0 minutes to arrive.
This means Abel arrives 1500.0-1200.0= <<1500.0-1200.0=3000.0>>3000.0 minutes before Alice if they both leave simultaneously.
However, since Abel had a head start of 1 hour, which is 60 minutes, this means Abel arrives 3000.0 + 60 = <<3000.0+60=3060.0>>3060.0 minutes ahead of Alice

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 300.0, not 3000.0. It appears an extra zero was added to the number.
